intro: Leptodermis kumaonensis, commonly known as the Kumaon leptodermis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
